jobs.title: Business Development Manager - Healthcare specialist
jobs.description:
We're changing the way people pay for the better. Better for People. Better for business.
A more responsible way, unlocking new possibilities for personal and business finances. We're not an old school financial institution, we don't walk talk or take like one. We're driving the next generation of financial tech. And we are here to empower our customers. The future is exciting, the possibilities endless. Welcome to Openpay!

The Role
The successful Business Development Manager will be responsible for revenue generation from enterprise and mid-market companies within the Healthcare space. The business development manager is to identify sales leads, pitch to new clients and maintain a good working relationship internally, with prospects and new clients.
•	Identify new business opportunities, qualify and close deals
•	Following up new business opportunities, schedule meetings, and present
•	Planning and preparing presentations (say hello to Powerpoint, PDFs)
•	Communicating new product developments to prospective clients
•	Overseeing the development of marketing literature
•	Proficient in Salesforce, accurate data input and reporting
•	Input into sales strategy and go-to-market

To be considered you will have:
•	Proven senior sales experience with the ability to close deals within Healthcare 
•	Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization
•	Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs
•	Excellent sales and ability to run deals, end to end
•	Self-starter with high energy, motivation and focus on achieving targets
•	Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail
•	A dynamic personal presence whilst also being a true team player
•	Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills
•	Excellent verbal and written communications skills
•	A positive attitude that is flexible and open to change
•	Degree qualified

What’s in it for you?
•	Openpay is going global! We recently launched into the UK and our team are located around the world.
•	We have an innovative culture, our office is dynamic, fast-moving full of high energy team players
•	We have fun - we're a pretty easy-going team and work well in a fun environment that is going through an exciting time of growth
•	We value open communication – Own it with Passion and have your say
•	We celebrate individual differences - Be yourself, bring your own unique value
•	We enjoy each other’s company with frequent social events, and
•	We look after ourselves with a monthly wellness program

jobs.title: Trade Marketing Manager - 9 month contract
jobs.description:
We're changing the way people pay for the better. Better for People. Better for business.

A more responsible way, unlocking new possibilities for personal and business finances. We're not an old school financial institution, we don't walk talk or take like one. We're driving the next generation of financial tech. And we are here to empower our customers. The future is exciting, the possibilities endless. Welcome to Openpay!

We believe we win when our merchants win so the Merchant Marketing Manager will lead the marketing relationship with Openpay retail and retail partners and lead the development of co-marketing programs to drive plans through Openpay. The Merchant Marketing Manager will manage demand generation of client leads through extensive B2B marketing activity to support our aggressive growth plans. They will also manage multiple programs for existing clients from onboarding through to seasonal trade calendar planning and activity. The candidate must be able to effectively prioritise and produce a high volume of work in a timely manner.

The Responsibilities

Drive demand generation through B2B marketing activity to generate leads for the sales team
Cultivate strong professional relationships with our top tier retail partners, including a detailed understanding of their business goals, opportunities and challenges
Develop and executive creative multi-channel marketing campaigns that will gain cut-through and achieve results for both Openpay and business partners
Working with the Account Management and Marketing teams, developing a marketing strategy tailored to partner audiences and goals
Measure and report performance of campaigns to internal and external stakeholders
Collaborating with design resources to create exciting, on-brand content that fits within partner branding
Managing campaign budgets
Managing the end-to-end process for partner POS strategies
Work with internal resources and third-party agencies to develop custom marketing assets as needed.
Understand the competitive landscape and trends in consumer buying behaviours, and be able to develop appropriate responses and actions. 

The Requirements

Experience within B2B and B2C , retailer, e-commerce site, or agency required
Experience with or as part of a merchant organisation.
Demand generation experience
Strong knowledge of trade marketing
Bachelor degree or equivalent.
Understanding of and insight into the retail environment.
Strong demand generation skills.
Strong relationship-building skills.
Strong project management and campaign management experience.
Excellent written and verbal ability.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point.Experience and strength in building and managing relationships with merchant executives.
Strong communication and organisational skills
What’s in it for you?

Openpay is growing fast! We recently launched into the UK and our team are located around the world.
We have an innovative culture, our office is dynamic, fast-moving full of high energy team players
We have fun - we're a pretty easy-going team and work well in a fun environment that is going through an exciting time of growth
We value open communication – Own it with Passion and have your say
We celebrate individual differences - Be yourself, bring your own unique value
We enjoy each other’s company with frequent social events
We look after ourselves with a company wellness program
If this sounds like you, we'd love you to introduce yourself!

Short-listed candidates will be advised by telephone.  Please note, due to the requirements of this role, candidates must have full working rights in the UK.

Openpay is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.

Openpay will not accept emails, phone calls and CV's from recruiters

jobs.title: Product Requirements Manager
jobs.description:
We're changing the way people pay for the better. Better for People. Better for business.

A more responsible way, unlocking new possibilities for personal and business finances. We're not an old school financial institution, we don't walk talk or take like one. We're driving the next generation of financial tech. And we are here to empower our customers. The future is exciting, the possibilities endless. Welcome to Openpay!

The UK Product manager will be the vital link between the UK business and our Australian Product Team. You will head up the end-to-end development of business requirements to support the UK growth regarding consumer, merchant and employee experience.  

Working with the UK leadership team to understand the go to market strategy, you’ll conduct customer research, product/competitor evaluations, analyse business requirements and translate this into detailed product definitions with associated business benefits cases.  

To succeed in this role, you should have a strong customer experience background aligned to a solid technical understanding, a natural analytical way of thinking and an ability to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users as well as business concepts to technical staff.   You will have experience of operating in a high growth, fast paced agile environment. 

Key Responsibilities: 

Fully defining the innovation and improvement of our products for the UK market.  Collaboration with individual departments to anticipate requirements and contribute to the solution development 
Complete understanding of the product development roadmap and communication of any new development updates to the UK team – particularly the growth team  
Investigation and analysis of the product and the product market: Develop customer research capability to evaluate merchant and consumer feedback and to understand the competitive landscape.  
Direct the business product strategy toward data and insight driven decisions. 
Develop requirements proposals for changes to the product to support the growth in regards to consumer, employee and merchant experience. 
Build business cases that understand the business benefit as defined by customer experience improvement and financial upside 
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. 
Working closely with customers, technical, and managerial staff 
Prioritising business cases based on business needs and requirements, managing competing resources and priorities. 
Feeding into developing product initiatives applicable across the entire business  
Meeting with Product Managers across the various products to create synergy between the UK business needs and the Australian Product Development & Tech Teams 

Skills, experience and behaviours required: 

Previous experience as a product manager defining digital business offerings  
Strong people skills – you’ll have to collaborate well with others across the globe to successfully convey to value of all proposed initiatives both to customers and to the business 
Ability to drive energised merchant and consumer workshops 
Strong visual aptitude, fluency in defining user workflows and sketching wireframes  
Ability to develop compelling business cases that demonstrate a strong commercial aptitude 
Proven ability of research and interpretation of users’ needs, intents and business cases into successful products 
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills  
Holistic view, ability to synergize between various requirements and integrated solutions  
Outstanding understanding of commercial, retail, ecommerce, financing domains and mobile/web development 
Proactive approach, continuous seeking for ways to achieve business growth and improvement, ability to think outside the box and solve problems creatively
